Customer_InvoiceObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Customer_InvoiceObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Customer_InvoiceObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing Customer Invoice for update only purposes.

Customer_Invoice_Collection_Information_.description: TRUE or FALSEIf this is set to 'TRUE' the invoice will be put on hold.
TRUE or FALSEIf this is set to 'TRUE' the invoice will be excluded from Print Dunning Letters.
The date the Customer Invoice should be followed up. This field is optional and can be entered in maintain collection, maintain dispute or put on hold.

validation.validation: Followup Date cannot be in the past.
validation.description: Followup Date cannot be in the past.

Customer_Invoice_Dispute_Data.description: The date the Customer Invoice is put into dispute. If this field is populated when updating an existing invoice, the invoice will be put into dispute.
The amount the Customer Invoice is in dispute over. It is optional.

validation.validation: A dispute amount can only be entered if there is a dispute date.
validation.description: A dispute amount can only be entered if there is a dispute date.

validation.validation: Dispute amount cannot be greater than the amount due.
validation.description: Dispute amount cannot be greater than the amount due.

Dispute_ReasonObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Dispute_ReasonObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Dispute_ReasonObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Customer_Invoice_Dispute_Data.description: The reason the Customer Invoice is put into dispute.

validation.validation: A dispute reason can only be entered if there is a dispute date.
validation.description: A dispute reason can only be entered if there is a dispute date.

Customer_Invoice_Collection_Data.description: The date the Customer Invoice is put into collection. If this field is populated when updating an existing invoice, the invoice will be put into collection.
The amount the customer promised to pay when the Customer Invoice is put into collection. It is optional.

validation.validation: Payment amount promised cannot be greater than the amount due.
validation.description: Payment amount promised cannot be greater than the amount due.

validation.validation: Promise to pay amount can only be entered if there is a collection date.
validation.description: Promise to pay amount can only be entered if there is a collection date.

Collection_CodeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Collection_CodeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Collection_CodeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Customer_Invoice_Collection_Data.description: The reason the Customer Invoice is put into collection. It is optional.

validation.validation: A Collection Code can only be entered if there is a collection date.
validation.description: A Collection Code can only be entered if there is a collection date.

Note_WWS_Data.description: The date and time this Note was created. On a Put or Submit operation, this field is ignored, and will be overwritten with the current date and time.
The date and time this Note was last updated. On a Put or Submit operation, this field is ignored, and will be overwritten with the current date and time.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Note_WWS_Data.description: The Worker who created this Note (if the person who created it is a Worker). On a Put or Submit operation, this field is ignored, and will be overwritten by the person processing the request.

Business_Entity_ContactObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_Entity_ContactObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_Entity_ContactObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Note_WWS_Data.description: The Business Entity Contact who created this Note (if the person who created it is a Business Entity Contact and not a Worker). On a Put or Submit operation, this field is ignored, and will be overwritten with the person processing the request.

System_UserObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

System_UserObjectID.type: WID,  System_User_ID,  System_User_OpenID,  System_User_OpenID_Connect_Internal,  System_User_OpenID_Internal,  WorkdayUserName
System_UserObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

System_UserObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Note_WWS_Data.description: The System User who created this Note (if the person who created it is neither a Business Entity Contact nor a Worker). On a Put or Submit operation, this field is ignored, and will be overwritten with the person processing the request.
The main text content for this Note.

Customer_Invoice_Collection_Information_.description: Includes Notes that have been made for a business object. On a Get operation, all existing Notes will be populated. On a Put or Submit operation, any note information on the request will be added as new notes. Existing notes cannot be updated on a Put or Submit request.

validation.validation: Collection And Dispute are chosen at the same time.
